translated: The Four-Part Collection🔽The Chapter on the Adulterer of a Householder
“One who does not take with the body,
who does not speak falsehood with the voice;
who, having gained fame, does not become intoxicated—
he is worthy of the cry of ‘Kakkāru!’”

analyzed: dhammena vittam eseyya  na nikatyā dhanam hare
translated: “One who would acquire wealth through righteousness,🔽who would not take wealth through deceit;
who, having gained wealth, would not become intoxicated—
he is worthy of the cry of ‘Kakkāru!’”
who would not eat alone what is good—

original: sa ve kakkārumarahati”.🔽“Sammukhā vā tirokkhā vā,
analyzed: sa ve kakkārum arahati  sammukhā vā tirokkhā vā
translated: he is worthy of the cry of ‘Kakkāru!’”🔽“One who does not revile the peaceful,
whether in his presence or behind his back;
he is worthy of the cry of ‘Kakkāru!’”
The Birth Story of Kakkāru, the Sixth.
